samples: The two brothers could not have been more different.

contents-list.explanation: to hit someone or something with your foot.
samples: He kicked the ball into the goal.

contents-list.explanation: having great physical power and ability.
samples: He's as strong as an ox.

contents-list.explanation: a person who attends a school, college, or university.
samples: She is a student at our local elementary school.

contents-list.explanation: to do something again and again in oeder to become better at it.
samples: To be a good musician, you have to practice a lot.

contents-list.explanation: one of the 24 equal parts of a day.
samples: The job pays ten dollars an hour.

contents-list.explanation: to try to make yourself stronger, faster or better at doing something before competing in an event or competition.
samples: The team trains five hours a day.

contents-list.explanation: with a lot of effort or energy.
samples: You have to work hard in order to succeed.

contents-list.explanation: someone or something, such as a team or an animal that has won a contest or competition especially in sports.
samples: Our team will play the defending champions next week.
It is a fight for the heavyweight title.
The teacher asked us to remain calm after the fire alarm went off.

contents-list.explanation: very enthusiastic and eager about something.
samples: They were excited about the trip.

contents-list.explanation: a contest between two or more players or teams
samples: I watched a boring soccer match last week.

contents-list.explanation: to stop an activity or effort.
samples: The is too hard; I give up!

contents-list.explanation: a person who performs various physical exercises on a mat or on special equipment as part of an athletic competition.
samples: She was gymnast for seven years.

contents-list.explanation: someone who participates in the sport of boxing.

samples: He becomes the most famous footballer in the world.
He was a top ranked tennis player in high school.
A group of cyclists are waving towards us.
